name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: 5. So for the last time: this issue is about constitutional values, the foundational pluralist idea of India. Not Hindu vs Muslim.  BJP is looking for an opportunity to paint this agitation in communal colours. Don’t give it to them.

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: 4. My point is, of course I understand what's at stake for the Muslim community. But that's because the basic idea of Indian pluralism is threatened. Broadbase the cause. You can't fight Hindutva communalism by promoting Muslim communalism. Identity politics will destroy India.

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: 3. How are nonMuslims to understand that in a protest about CAA-NRC, “tera mera rishta” refers to the individual’s relationship w/God?God shouldn’t come into this. BJP are gleefully circulating such videos onWA, telling Hindus “see what this fight’s about; which side are you on?"

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: 2. I also understand the primordial place of the Kalima in the Islamic faith. "La ilaha ilallah" is unexceptionable in itself. It's the context that matters here; the phrase ‘tera mera rishta la ilaha illallah’ tends to isolate the community from others whose rishta is to India.

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: Happy birthday @amymjoyy!! Venesa told me it is your special day today --  many happy returns.

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet:
2/2
Its returns do not bolster
The corporate balance sheet;
They come in a pristine morning smile,
In words that do not cheat.
If you think that too paper-thin,
Too silly for reward,
Give it a try with heart and soul,
You may see the face of god.

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet:
1/2 
Tougher than the ease of business
Is the ease of caring
An enterprise more challenging
More rich in daring.
Its investment is not in pound,
Rupee, dollar, Franc;
It asks a parting of the riches
From the soul’s innermost bank.
[ctd]

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: My key point: humankind cannot enjoy security without development, cannot enjoy development without security,& cannot enjoy either without human rights,which in turn rests on rule of law underwritten by democratic Parliaments. Counter-terrorism should not be at the cost of h.rts.

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: A journalist asked if we would seek "RSS votes"in this by-election. My reply: I am not seeking the votes of any organisation, but of individual voters irrespective of their past preferences. Voters are individuals and votes have no affiliation till they are cast.

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: 3/3 To put it bluntly, the excutive, in the name of its Parliamentary majority, cannot use Parliament's own powers&privileges to undermine itself. In short, Parliament cannot be induced by its own majority to commit suicide. Note: UK precedents are often cited by Indian courts.

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: 2/3 the executive cannot simply distort the rules of procedure&conduct of business under the garb of the Parliament's privilege as a sovereign body to do as it wants. The Court's reasoning is that the executive's legislative majority cannot be used to obstruct Parliament's work.

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: 1/3 The significance of today's UK Supreme Court judgement for those of us who live in other parliamentary systems inspired by the British model should not be missed. The judgement makes clear that the leeway for the political executive to subvert convention is limited: contd.

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: Since the area where the buildings are is now certified permissible for construction, the order appears to be based on the argument that the old CRZ classification prevailed at the time they were built. So destroy bldgs that used to be illegal then but are legal now? Makes sense?

name: Shashi Tharoor
tweet: The logic of demolition would be that if the buildings stayed up they would damage the environment. But demolition would release tons of debris & dust into the air. And rebuilding, ditto. At the end the buildings would come back but the losers would be 356 innocent families.
